title: Dinner Menu Recommender
h1: What should I eat for dinner tonight?
contact_description: Thank you for your interest in our service. Please fill out the form below if you'd like to partner with us.
footer_copyright: © 2026 What's for Dinner? All rights reserved.
intro_desc: Struggling to decide what to eat for dinner? 'What's for Dinner?' randomly recommends a variety of dinner menus with just one click. Explore options from Korean, Western, Chinese and more!
target_1_title: Busy professionals with daily menu fatigue
target_1_desc: Save time deciding what to eat after work. One click and your dinner is decided.
target_2_title: Those who want to expand their cooking repertoire
target_2_desc: Always eating the same thing? Try something new with random recommendations.
target_3_desc: When it's hard to pick a menu the whole family will enjoy, let our recommender decide for you.
howto_step1_desc: Click the 'Get Recommendation' button at the top to get a random menu suggestion from Korean, Western, Chinese, Japanese, and other cuisines.
howto_step2_desc: The recommended menu appears prominently on screen. If it doesn't suit you, click the button again for a different suggestion.
howto_step3_desc: All recommendations are automatically saved in the history section below. Review your past suggestions to help plan your meals.
faq_1_q: Q. Is the menu recommendation free?
faq_1_a: Yes, it's completely free! No sign-up required — just visit the site and get instant recommendations.
faq_2_q: Q. What kinds of menus are recommended?
faq_2_a: We recommend dishes from Korean cuisine (Kimchi Jjigae, Bibimbap), Western cuisine (Pasta, Steak), Chinese cuisine (Jajangmyeon, Jjamppong), Japanese cuisine (Sushi, Donkatsu), and more.
faq_3_a: Your recommendation history is displayed on screen during your current session. It resets when you refresh the page, so we recommend noting down any favorites.
faq_4_q: Q. Does it work on mobile?
faq_4_a: Yes! The site is fully optimized for mobile devices. Use it comfortably on smartphones, tablets, or any device with a web browser.
faq_5_q: Q. How do I enable dark mode?
faq_5_a: Click the 'Switch to Dark Mode' button at the top of the page. Your preference is saved automatically for your next visit.
quick_tip_1_desc: Seasonal produce tastes better and costs less. Spring greens, summer corn, fall mushrooms, and winter stews are always a great choice.
quick_tip_2_desc: Choose meals that include protein, carbs, and vegetables for a well-balanced dinner.
quick_tip_3_desc: Go for quick 15-minute meals on busy days, and try elaborate recipes when you have more time.
about_what_desc: 'What's for Dinner?' is a free web service that solves the daily dinner menu dilemma. Just press a button and get a random menu recommendation from various categories including Korean, Western, and Chinese cuisine. You can also view your recommendation history to see what you've been suggested before.
about_why_desc: "What should I eat for dinner?" — it's a question everyone asks at least once a day. Especially for those who prepare dinner daily, choosing a menu can be stressful. We created this simple yet practical menu recommendation service to ease that burden, even just a little.
about_mission_desc: We aim for 'stress-free mealtimes.' We want to help reduce the time and energy wasted on choosing dinner menus every day, so you can focus more on spending time with family and enjoying the art of cooking. It's a small service, but if it adds convenience to your daily life, that's all we need.
about_feature_1: One-click random menu recommendation — no complex settings needed
about_feature_2: Recommendation history — see all your past recommendations at a glance
about_feature_3: Dark/Light mode — reduce eye strain with theme switching
about_feature_5: Mobile optimized — use it conveniently anywhere
about_value_1_desc: We focus solely on menu recommendations without unnecessary features. No complex settings or sign-up processes — use it instantly.
about_value_2_desc: With over 20 menus across Korean, Western, Chinese, Japanese, and quick meals, you'll get a fresh recommendation every time.
about_value_3_desc: No sign-up, no app installation. Anyone with a web browser can use it completely free of charge.
privacy_intro: 'What's for Dinner?' (hereinafter 'the Service') values users' privacy and complies with relevant laws. This Privacy Policy explains what information the Service collects and how it is used.
privacy_collect_desc: The Service does not require registration and does not directly collect personal information. However, through the partnership inquiry form, we may collect your name, email address, and message content, which are processed via Formspree.
privacy_cookies_desc: The Service uses browser localStorage to save your theme preference (dark/light mode) and language setting (Korean/English) for a better experience. This information is stored only on your device and is not transmitted to any server.
privacy_ads_desc: The Service displays ads through Google AdSense. Google may use cookies to serve ads based on your visits to this site and other sites. You can opt out of personalized advertising through Google Ad Settings.
privacy_third_desc: The Service uses the following third-party services:
privacy_third_formspree: Formspree — handles contact form submissions. Formspree's own privacy policy applies.
privacy_third_adsense: Google AdSense — serves advertisements. Google's own privacy policy applies.
privacy_changes_desc: This Privacy Policy may be updated as needed, and changes will be announced on this page.
privacy_contact_desc: For privacy-related inquiries, please use the partnership inquiry form on the homepage.
tips_page_title: Dinner Tips Guide - What's for Dinner?
tips_intro: Learn how to prepare tastier, healthier, and more efficient dinners every day. Try these 5 tips to solve your dinner dilemma!
tip_1_desc: Planning your dinner menus for the week makes grocery shopping more efficient and saves daily decision-making time. Set your menu on Sunday and buy all the ingredients at once to save time and money.
tip_1_detail: Pro tip: Post the menu on your fridge or save it in your phone's notes.
tip_2_desc: Seasonal ingredients are more nutritious and affordable. Knowing the signature ingredients of each season helps you prepare tastier meals.
tip_2_spring: Spring: wild greens, garlic chives, spring cabbage, baby octopus
tip_2_fall: Fall: mushrooms, sweet potatoes, shrimp, crab
tip_3_desc: Prepping ingredients and making side dishes on weekends greatly reduces weekday dinner prep time. Making sauces and marinades in advance is also a great strategy.
tip_3_detail: Recommended meal prep: dicing onions, peeling garlic, blanching vegetables, marinating meat
tip_4_desc: The foundation of a healthy dinner is nutritional balance. Try to include protein, carbohydrates, and vegetables in every meal.
tip_4_carb: Carbs: rice, brown rice, noodles, bread
tip_4_veggie: Vegetables: seasonal veggies, salads, vegetable side dishes
tip_5_desc: Eating the same meals repeatedly can make dining boring. Challenge yourself with 2-3 new recipes per month. Following easy recipes on YouTube or cooking apps will improve your skills and make mealtimes more enjoyable.
tip_5_detail: Great starter recipes: Japanese curry, cream pasta, japchae, kimbap
tips_cat_korean_items: Kimchi Jjigae, Doenjang Jjigae, Bibimbap, Bulgogi, Galbi Jjim, Japchae, Sundubu Jjigae
tips_cat_western_items: Steak, Cream Pasta, Risotto, Omurice, Hamburg Steak
tips_cat_chinese_items: Jajangmyeon, Jjamppong, Sweet and Sour Pork, Mapo Tofu, Fried Rice
tips_cat_quick_items: Sandwich, Salad, Fried Rice, Egg Roll, Kimchi Fried Rice
